nodes.documentation:
@title Contract for enforcing a list of addresses allowed to send or receive tokens
@dev Until the whitelist expiration expires, this contract only permits
token transfers in which an allowed transactor is either the sender or
recipient. Once the whitelist expiration passes, it becomes impossible to
re-enable the whitelist.
 * This contract inherits from PausableToken to enforce both pausing and
whitelists for transfer calls.
nodes.name: WhitelistedPausableToken

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "neither sender nor recipient are allowed"

arguments.value: neither sender nor recipient are allowed

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "neither sender nor recipient are allowed"

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "an expired whitelist cannot be extended"

arguments.value: an expired whitelist cannot be extended

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "an expired whitelist cannot be extended"

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "whitelist expiration not far enough into the future"

arguments.value: whitelist expiration not far enough into the future

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "whitelist expiration not far enough into the future"

nodes.documentation:
@dev Set the whitelist expiration, after which the whitelist no longer
applies.
nodes.name: setWhitelistExpiration
